channel.title: Was Bored- Auth System Site
channel.description:
I was bored and felt like coding some PHP, so i made this in 2 days.
http://kaney.freehostia.com/auths/
Doesn't use MySQL for databases, or anything.. Just text files and encryption. Couldn't be bothered learning MySQL.

item.title: Was Bored- Auth System Site
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“MastrChief, post:42, topic:148619”][quote author=XxKanexX link=topic=203791.msg1797412#msg1797412 date=1191412225]
I was bored and felt like coding some PHP
[/quote]

Yea… That IS php.

The difference, if you hadn’t seen it, is text files instead of mysql databases for storage of user data.[/quote]
Sarcasm, no?

Read full topic

item.title: Was Bored- Auth System Site
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

Night26:

that limits the names to characters of regular filenames and moving the data would be a pain, not to mention the lack of foreign exportability. (Like you cannot share authentication with other sites). Anyhow its a good project for a small site

As for moving the data, I could just write a small script that transfers to ‘Auths’ folder… Not sure if freehostia has a “save/zip” option. Hmm.

Read full topic

item.title: Was Bored- Auth System Site
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“Night26, post:31, topic:148619”]Flatfile databases have many significant problems… It’s all good and all if you are storing encryptions for 200 accounts, but think what would happen when you open files with 200,000 account info stored in them? The response time would be a tremendous pain, with searching through the file a line at a time… I mean its a quick neat solution to websites without mysql support, but wherever there is db support, I strongly reccomend the use of it.

Anyhow, nice script.[/quote]
You can only create 100 accounts… And all the accounts aren’t in 1 text file, each user has their own text file for their accounts.

[quote=“RXVL, post:26, topic:148619”][quote author=XxKanexX link=topic=203791.msg1801844#msg1801844 date=1191577428]

Ok Kane, I’d blow you for the source to this =].

Why do you want it so bad?

Anything in particular about it? I can send you some of the stuff but it’s all rather messy coding.
[/quote]

I like it because it doesn’t require MySQL (I hate having to run a MySQL database) and the fact that I’m trying to learn more PHP, but I learn better from example, and this would be a good one.[/quote]
Basically it just uses fwrite, fopen, fread, etc.

For example;
If someone creates an account, no errors then it will mkdir (create directory) their folder, then fwrite all the text files inside and such.

Read full topic

item.title: Was Bored- Auth System Site
item.dc:creator: @Night26 Night26
item.description:
@Night26 wrote:

Flatfile databases have many significant problems… It’s all good and all if you are storing encryptions for 200 accounts, but think what would happen when you open files with 200,000 account info stored in them? The response time would be a tremendous pain, with searching through the file a line at a time… I mean its a quick neat solution to websites without mysql support, but wherever there is db support, I strongly reccomend the use of it.

Anyhow, nice script.

Read full topic

item.title: Was Bored- Auth System Site
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

[quote=“OnlyOneRule, post:20, topic:148619”][quote author=1337h4x link=topic=203791.msg1800638#msg1800638 date=1191548331]

… Impossible… You have to include Ajax o read from txt files…
[/quote]I did it in a different way. There is an html file with encrypted data that needs a pass to unencrypt. The login redirects to the html file that has the name (eg if you type in “namehere” for name it will redirect you to “namehere.html”) which passes the pass as a parameter. No file reading involved.

Not extremely efficent, but it’s great for simple stuff.

That’s no where near to what Kane has made…[/quote]Keyword “something”? Plus, although execution might be different, the outcomes (front end) are rather alike.

Read full topic

item.title: Was Bored- Auth System Site
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd

… Impossible… You have to include Ajax o read from txt files…
[/quote]I did it in a different way. There is an html file with encrypted data that needs a pass to unencrypt. The login redirects to the html file that has the name (eg if you type in “namehere” for name it will redirect you to “namehere.html”) which passes the pass as a parameter. No file reading involved.

Not extremely efficent, but it’s great for simple stuff.[/quote]Oh man, that’s a bunch of fail, imo.

Read full topic

item.title: Was Bored- Auth System Site
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

[quote=“OnlyOneRule, post:10, topic:148619”]… Impossible… You have to include Ajax o read from txt files…[/quote]I did it in a different way. There is an html file with encrypted data that needs a pass to unencrypt. The login redirects to the html file that has the name (eg if you type in “namehere” for name it will redirect you to “namehere.html”) which passes the pass as a parameter. No file reading involved.

Not extremely efficent, but it’s great for simple stuff.

Read full topic
